title: Class 3 Math - Number Names and Letter Counting
description: Test focusing on number names, letter counting in words, and number recognition from Chapter 1
subject: Mathematics

questions.question: How many letters are in the number name 'FIFTY-SIX'?
questions.explanation: F-I-F-T-Y-S-I-X = 8 letters (counting the hyphen as a separator).

questions.question: Which number between 1 and 99 has the longest name?
questions.explanation: Ninety-nine has more letters than other numbers in this range.

questions.question: How many letters are in the number name 'SEVENTEEN'?
If your roll number is 43, how many letters are in its number name 'FORTY-THREE'?
Which number name has exactly 6 letters?
questions.explanation: F-I-V-E = 5 letters, S-E-V-E-N = 5 letters, E-I-G-H-T = 5 letters, N-I-N-E = 4 letters. None have exactly 6 letters, but FIVE is closest.

questions.question: How many letters are in the word 'MATHEMATICS'?
If you write the number 25 in words, how many letters does it have?
Which number name has the fewest letters?
questions.explanation: ONE = 3 letters, TWO = 3 letters, THREE = 5 letters, FOUR = 4 letters. ONE and TWO both have 3 letters.

questions.question: How many letters are in the number name 'EIGHTY-EIGHT'?
If a number name has two words and the first word has 6 letters, which number could it be?
questions.explanation: SEVENTY = 7 letters, EIGHTY = 6 letters, NINETY = 6 letters, FIFTY = 5 letters. EIGHTY and NINETY both have 6 letters.
